reviewText: Just as described- a perfect addition to any horror collection.

I liked that the picture quality and audio is awesome and that it works just perfectly. I like the 3 Halloween movies in the Triple Feature Blur Ray although the theatrical cut of Halloween 6 was weird, it's confusing and made no sense, plus the ending of Halloween 6 theatrical cut was messed up.
Okay, I am really stupid. The first two movies are on one side and the 3rd is on the second. I am doing this review to help others. I love all of Halloween and this was a boss deal.
A little disappointed because I really wanted the full set not just 3 movies

While all three movies are in HD as you expect, you should keep in mind that there are no special features. There's barely a menu. The Blu-Ray is JUST the three movies, and nothing else. There's not even scene selections available.
great set

love it
awesome bargain for your Halloween collection...warning though, no subtitles on at least some of the movies...not sure about all.
Great quality of the DVD movies

This was a gift for someone who wanted to switch over their collection from VHS to DVD. I wanted to get them the entire Halloween set, so this was part of it. Who doesn't love a great classic horror movie!!

The only reason I'm not returning is it was so cheap, it'd probably be more trouble than it's worth. The only movie on the DVD I received is Halloween 6. H20 and Resurrection are not included. Only $5, but still would like to have received all three titles, as advertised.
One of the movies was missing. That kind of bums me out but Im not going to make abig stink about it

I loved the movie it was very good

I liked how all the movies got well 1080P HD Transfers and that the audio is English 2.0 DTS-HD Master Audio. This Blu-ray triple feature is better than the one Echo Bridge Home Entertainment release a few years back. There might not be no special features on here, we shouldn't complain because we got these three movies in HD.

HALLOWEEN: RESURRECTION
The reality programmers at DangerTainment have selected a group of thrill-seeking teenagers to spend one fun-filled night in the childhood home of serial killer Michael Meyers. But the planned live broadcast turns deadly when their evening of excitement becomes a night of horror as Michael himself decides to crash the party.

HALLOWEEN: H2O
Now the headmistress of a private school, Laurie Strode (Jamie Lee Curtis) is still struggling with the horrifying, 20-year-old memories of the maniacal killer Michael Myers...when he suddenly reappears with a vengeance. Laurie's rebellious son, his girlfriend, and the school security guard will become Michael's newest victims unless Laurie can conquer her greatest fears and put evil in its place once and for all.

HALLOWEEN: THE CURSE OF MICHAEL MYERS
In a single horrifying night, Michael Myers' masked reign of terror changed Halloween forever. Now, six years after he was presumed dead in a fire, Myers has returned to kill againand this time there's no escape. As the homicidal fury builds to a spine-tingling climax, the long-hidden secrets of the screen's most maniacal murderer are revealed...with shocking results.
Awesome item! Thanks!
Good
Nice
Classic horror!

Set contains Halloween 6, 7, and 8 (the last 3 before Rob Zombie's remakes). All play in 16x9 format. All were quality digital transfers in 1080P and were sharp and clear, just as you would expect with Blu-ray. All in English 2.0 DTS audio. Each movie has a "movie select" option on the top menu, making it easy to navigate between the three titles. A good deal for three movies.
We had a good time showing older movie classics. The kids enjoyed them too!
Watching it as I'm writing this. It wasn't the movies I expected but I still enjoy them and it's working perfectly. Delivered right on time

I thought it had Halloween I, II & III but it didn't have III. How am I supposed know what is in there if it doesn't say anything except just three movies? I personally don't like the character of the rest of the movie.

For 5 dollars more get the box set. Its rear to find part 2 (1981) in a box set, so take advantage of the complete collection with extra footage and commentarys.
